My Profile My Profile My Workday Profile

record.pwc_description: Bring greater relevance to your clients with Sector Navigator: Technology, Media, Telecommunications.

The One Firm Smart Pricing site is our one-stop shop for all aspects of Smart Pricing strategies and resources, designed to help partners, directors and managers and all account teams convert rates and hours to fixed fee and other alternative pricing arrangements, where appropriate, for client contracts and engagements. The focus is on partnering with clients for value that reflects our investment in digital assets, intellectual proprerty, and our talent, rather than just time and materials, which only reflects cost not value. LoS pages on the site provide specific direction for each business area.

At PwC, our people are our most important asset. You should know that the firm is committed to ensuring the safety and wellbeing of each of our employees as well as their families. As part of this commitment, your Security team has developed this Spark page to help prepare your in the event of a disaster. We'll provide information, news and alerts, and ask for feedback to develop a culture that values safety and security. Every partner and staff member should feel that he or she is in charge of keeping the facility safe, and knowing what to do in a crisis. Additionally, your security team reviews and recommends security controls, policies and programs designed to protect the firm's people and assets. This includes managing the firm's background screening, crisis management, business continuity, physical security, travel security, security awareness programs, as well as providing investigative services.

The Nursing Moms' Program is designed to assist new mothers with relevant prenatal and postnatal breastfeeding counseling by a team of experts in the field of lactation. The program is available at no cost to all (US firm) PwC women (including part-time staff who are ineligible for benefits) as well as PwC spouses and domestic partners.

The Business Travel to Know site (formerly Voyager) contains the firm's online booking tool, SAP Concur Travel & Expense. There are no fees to book travel and it's available 24/7. In addition to booking travel, new travel and expense policies are available along with information pertaining to PwC preferred travel programs.
Global talent and resource management tool that enables us to respond to emerging client problems with speed.
Provides eligible US staff with financial assistance to further their education.
Share UiPath best practices and tips and tricks, ask questions, collaborate with peers, and learn more about robotics.

Whether you're on a PC or on our new mobile app, the service hub is your central location to get internal support. It's an easy way to search for answers to your questions, place orders, make support requests, find reference guides, resolve issues and find support options for IT, Human Resources, Compliance Resource Center, Finance and more. All our support options -- including self-service tickets and chat -- can be found by selecting Get Help on the main page of the hub.

Find Tech While You Trek podcasts in the Digital Hub or in the PwC Podcasts app (available in PwC's App Store). Hear engaging stories about individual, team and client interactions with the technologies straight from those leading PwC's efforts.
Supports the Network Information Security team.
Bring greater relevance to your clients with Sector Navigators (X-Sector).
Your go-to source for Tax Reform resources across all lines of service. In addition to the LOS materials, there is a special section for GEPs.
Corporate and individual taxes in over 150 territories worldwide.

Application used by external PwC talent and internal PwC engagement managers to match skills to jobs. Resume parsing, profile building, job postings and pricing events are just a few features that will expedite the PwC onboarding and offboarding process to accommodate the US labor force shift toward a higher number of freelancers to meet future PwC and its clients labor requirements.
This policy sets out the requirements for retaining and disposing information created, received or maintained by PwC and its US- and Mexico-based subsidiaries.
View webcasts from the firm's webcast portal.
The Time & Expense site contains links to the TED database, key finance policies, popular T&E forms, mobile time information and access to the SAP Concur Travel Expense portal.
The US Leadership Team works collaboratively with our partners and staff to drive our business strategy and enable our firm's success.
Discounts on thousands of products and services for PwC employees.
Submit a request to the US Research Services Team.

The Talent Exchange is a first-of-its-kind, technology-enabled marketplace. It gives our teams an on-demand platform to find, directly connect and collaborate with top independent talent. It's more than just a new channel to bring on third-party labor. It's a commitment to changing how we think about, and work with, independent talent. It is a streamlined, integrated platform that helps build durable relationships with independent talent while reducing our costs and improving our tax and legal risk posture. The Talent Exchange gives us the power to stay ahead of a shifting workforce, to strategically supplement and complement our existing teams with highly-skilled talent who enable us to continue growing and serving our clients in this new world.

Working globally enhances our ability to serve our clients, provides opportunities for our people, strengthens our brand and drives growth, but it also presents language and translation challenges. That's why we are introducing PwC Translate -- a free, automated tool that instantly translates content between dozens of languages. Choose your origin and target languages from the drop downs, cut and paste the words, phrases or paragraphs you want translated, and with a click of a button you will have a translation. The tool has even been pre-loaded with preferred translations specific to the firm, such as how we refer to the lines of service and other PwC vernacular.

The SNAP team works xLOS to assist our Partners in the strategic development of business and commercial terms by looking at the overall objectives of the Firm and our Clients. We do this by supporting MSAs, rate cards, deals and occasionally disputes. We help to develop the overall negotiation strategy when dealing with Procurement. We support rate strategy, creative deal structures and reverse auctions as well as the execution of contract negotiations with a goal of ultimately driving improved economic terms for the Firm.
Use IRS use forms and publications search to find and download current forms, instructions and publications.

Skills for Society is a new approach to the way we build skills and make an impact in our communities. We'll put our digital and professional capabilities to work with nonprofits on some of the biggest societal challenges we face today, so we can make a difference while continuing to grow and develop.
Me@PwC provides a snapshot of your PwC retirement plans and links you to Benefits Express for more details and to make transactions.
PwC's Request It portal helps you navigate the complete lifecycle of sourcing products and services.
US Public Communications and Social Media Policy.
Vantage is PwC's learning management system -- a personalized approach to learning all in one place.

PwC's Risk Assurance Practice consists of more than 3,500 professionals with significant industry and technical experience across the risk and compliance spectrum, supporting the firm's RIsk & Regulatory platform. Solution areas include: Digital Risk Solutions (DRS), Internal Audit, Compliance & Risk Management Solutions (ICRS), Process Assurance (PA) and Trust & Transparency Solutions (TTS).

Our Total Rewards strategy serves as our guiding principle to support both our people and business strategies. Total rewards refers to your entire rewards package from base pay and bonus to career milestones to non-monetary rewards, health and wellness benefits, and retirement programs. They are designed to recognize the growth you've achieved and the contributions you've made.

Share information and collaborate on the latest Workday news, articles and press releases. Here, discuss cloud leading practices, share sales information and strategies, provide thought leadership, and best practices.
Use Qualtrics to develop online surveys. You can design a survey using pre-built survey templates.
Request an automated password reset.
Discounted TurboTax for income tax returns is available to all US partners and staff. Cost varies based on the TurboTax platform (Online vs. Download) and product (Deluxe, Premier etc.)
Find your path to financial independence. This program helps you develop strong money management habits today and build your financial future.

This tool provides guidance on pricing methods, pricing enablers/levers, target minimum IPR and target margin for Tax services.This tool does not alter our existing policies and regulatory requirements related to independence, contingent fees, or phased engagements. Please continue to follow the protocols related to these policies and reach out to the Independence Group within OFRO with any questions.

Find links for scheduling a video conference, getting help, quick reference cards, and training guides. Video Conferencing allows us to seamlessly connect with our colleagues and clients around the country, and around the world, all from our local PwC office.
Access current and historical payroll data.
Order and purchase gifts and other merchandise with PwC's brand imagery and logos, for use with clients, staff, events and anniversaries.

SuperForm Tax Forms provides 17,000+ interactive forms, worksheets, instructions, and publications for preparing returns for individuals, corporations, pass-through entities, estate & gift, sales and use, payroll tax, and information reporting.

PwC strives to be a place where parents have the flexibility and resources they need to manage their responsibilities. That's why we created this websitea collection of information on our programs and policies. Prepared Parent is a resource for anyone who has had a baby, is having a babyor thinks they might want to someday.

Salesforce (formerly Iris) is a tool for managing accounts, opportunities, contacts, and marketing across the firm -- it works hand in hand with other firm tools to help us build and sustain our client network, track appropriate client relationships, and convert them into permissible business opportunities when the time is right.

New clients must be evaluated to understand professional risk associated with prospective clients in the US or Mexico. Client acceptance procedures must be completed and have an accepted status before signing an engagement letter and starting any work, including performing an Adverse Data Search (ADS). Use the resources included to navigate through the process.
Your source for all things proposal.
Global talent and resource management tool that enables us to respond to emerging client problems with speed.

Let's say you're asked to sit down with a new recruit. Or you're going to have coffee with a client and explain a new way we'll be using technology on their engagement. Or your family is asking what's happening at your job. We created the Digital Story to help you have all of these conversations.
PwC's global desktop collaboration tool, offering a variety of ways to interact, including desktop sharing, polling, integrated chat and Q&A, whiteboard and recording for playback.

We Get Connected with our new people experience, using Workday. We have one human capital system for our global network. That means we can move faster when our clients need help, and we can focus on building the right teams.
Benchmarks allow for specific and defensible opportunity sizing, helping win more work and highlight critical issues more quickly and effectively.
Program that provides financial rewards for engaging in healthy and responsible behaviors.
Parental leave benefits that the firm offers to new parents, with various policies and programs which may help you along the journey.

Let's say you're asked to sit down with a new recruit. Or you're going to have coffee with a client and explain a new way we'll be using technology on their engagement. Or your family is asking what's happening at your job. We created the Digital Story to help you have all of these conversations.

We work with clients to develop both short and long-term solutions to the major people & organization challenges facing their business. Some of our key capabilities include Change Management, Workforce Capability, HR Transformation, and Organization Design. Access qualifications and case studies, capability tools and collateral, and events and communications materials here.

Our new Social Central simplifies sharing of PwC-approved content across your social media accounts. Account setup is fast, safe and secure. After selecting your categories of interest, you'll receive best-in-class content that's timely, relevant and ready to customize and share with your networks in just a few clicks.

Rapid Engage is not only a desktop and mobile dashboard tool to help teams navigate through the client and engagement start-up requirements... it starts to simplify and streamline the Contact to Code (C2C) process through automation, connecting disparate systems and data and serving as a single point of entry.

OGC supports the firm in various ways. Our mission is not only to protect the firm and promote compliance but also to strike the right balance between mitigating risk and supporting the firm in its various strategic initiatives. Whether it is a contracting question, a new service offering, responding to a subpoena or potential claim involving the firm or any other complex legal or regulatory matter, we can help you navigate the issue and explain the risks and considerations involved. Please don't hesitate to contact us we're here to help.
Phoenix is PwC's world-class workflow plaform

Use the PwC Podcasts app regularly to digitally upskill, build your business acumen and find professional inspiration with series such as Tech While You Trek, Inside Tax Policy, The Pursuit of Happiness and Well, Well, Well. Plus, tune in anytime for interviews with our senior leaders on topics like the future of work and how to be awesome at your job.
Document Management System (DMS) is the primary electronic document storage system for all Tax engagement deliverables and supporting documents.

With Your Tomorrow we're answering the expectations of the market with a bold step toward becoming best-in-class at gathering and using data to further enable high quality, efficient service delivery and provide even greater value to our clients. Watch the video to hear from our leaders about our data strategy and how PwC is 'going long' on data.
Have you moved? Or, did you get married or have a baby? No matter what your personal circumstance, it's important to keep your information up-to-date.
PCS Marketing Materials - PCS brochures, sector one-pagers, solution one-pagers, Advisory hot topics & more.
Bring greater relevance to your clients with Sector Navigator: Private Equity.
The tool contains multiple filter options and search functionality to locate WBS codes.

Relationship Checks require partners and managers to exercise significant professional judgment to help manage PwC's risk. The purpose of a Relationship Check is to assist teams with identifying existing PwC relationships that could result in the Firm entering into a prospective engagement or Joint Business Relationship (JBR) with an entity that may be prohibited by law; in breach of independence rules; potentially prohibited by an existing contractual requirement with a key relationship; harmful to an existing client relationship; or acceptable, but where PwC is performing services for clients which are on both sides of a transaction and we are required to obtain conflict waivers.

The Onboarding Inside Track site is PwC's first step in providing you with the knowledge, tools and confidence you need to take your career at PwC forward, linking you to the development you need to assimilate quickly and deliver the best results for our clients. This sites guides you through the onboarding process and helps you achieve a high level of engagement during your first six months.
Helps clients make critical data driven decisions.
Responsible Business Leadership is our commitment to make an impact in our communities and deliver business value by helping create a more equitable society.

The Records Management System (RMS) is PwC's records management system and it used to track the location and status of the firm's hardcopy records. It is available to create binder covers for hard copy work papers, and RMS binder covers are required for hard copy work papers for attest engagements.This system replaced the previous Binder Management System (BMS) on December 7th, 2009.

PwCs Ride Together program is an optional green transportation and commuting platform from Ride Shark, designed exclusively for PwC partners, principals and staff available as an app in the PwC app store or on your computer. PwC Ride Together offers a way to find easy and green ways to commute, including rideshares, biking and public transportation options. Enter where you are and where youre going, and the Ride Together platform will do the rest. If you match with a shared ride or a commuting buddy, its up to you if and when to contact them -- your personal information is never shared automatically.

PwC's Student Loan Paydown (SLP) benefit provides eligible associates and senior associates with $100 per month (or $1,200 per year) paid directly to their student loan servicer for up to six years, or until promotion to manager (whichever comes first).
PwC's App Store offers a curated collection of apps from PwC and beyond.

The Integrated Content team is PwC's in-house content agency. We are journalists, writers, economists, ex-consultants, and ex-policy analysts. We are thinking and writing partners to leaders of platforms and campaigns in the development of thought leadership. We operate in integrated marketing teams, working with business marketers, PR/Social, Creative, analytics, and Sales.

The ONESOURCE suite of tools provides end-to-end Federal, State and International income tax compliance and provision functionality for corporate engagements and operating partnerships. It has integrated workpapers, workflow, and project management capabilities

The OFRO Ecosystems, also known as the Risk Assessment Facilitation Team, are the specialists to consult any time you have an engagement-related question, whether at the earliest contact, at acceptance, or right through delivery.
Site to communicate our new partners (both internall and externally), their pictures, LoS, sector, market and additional information about them
Globally shared searchable repository of up-to-date proposals and proposal content to help you with your pursuits.

Each of us is responsible for the proper use, retention and disposal of the records we create and use at PwC, as well as the firm's systems and tools that allow us to share and store those records securely.
Secure the workspace that best meets your needs each day. Access hoteling, reserve meeting rooms, manage visitors and get help from the Space Concierge Team.

By answering a few simple questions, the Tool Finder summarizes a tailored output advising you of required and strongly recommended tools specific to your engagement, how to access them, and during which phase of the audit they are applicable.
Saying thanks fuels our emotional energy and aligns to Be well, work well, a vital component of Your Tomorrow.

TRACK is an end-to-end (Federal and State) tax reporting system that coordinates book information with tax adjustments, allocates and tiers taxable income to partners, provides detailed and aggregated reporting, produces Schedules K-1, and seamlessly bridges into our tax return software.
The PwC Surveys site is a one-stop shop where partners and staff can discover and complete surveys, and staff are entered to win a quarterly drawing for their participation.

Tool to assess progress against the five Dimensions of The PwC Professional and to gather data on Performance Differentiators and Development Actions (as appropriate) that will be used with other metrics in the end of year Career Roundtable discussions. It is used on all client engagements and non-client projects for client service and IFS staff.

Tableau is an interactive data visualization tool used to create customized worksheets, dashboards and story points that generate compelling business insight. Access resources to install Tableau, the PwC Data Catalog, branded PwC templates and Path to Ninja learning modules.

Helps organizations in private, public and social sector look at the big picture, by striking a balance between staying competitive, driving innovation, enhancing engagement with customers, investors and employees and preserving our environment while providing competitive advantage through sustainability.
Follow these instructions to print at PwC.

record.pwc_body: Child2-This is an article with headline image This is an Title of Child2 June 2, 2019 by Vijay I believe that everything happens for a reason. People change so that you can learn to let go, things go wrong so that you appreciate them when they're right, you believe lies so you eventually learn to trust no one but yourself, and sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together. Vijay Vijay Author Info Home Home

Child3-Article with image Child3-Article with image Chemicals June 3, 2019 by Joseph Quick read Quick Reads was launched in 2006. We work with well-known authors to write short and engaging books that are then distributed across libraries, prisons, colleges, hospitals and adult-learning organisations. They are also available in bookshops across the country. Since 2006, over 100 Quick Reads titles have been published; the books have been loaned more than 5 million times through libraries and over 4.8 million books have been distributed. The initiative has established a reputation for publishing top quality bestselling authors, including Andy McNab, Jojo Moyes, Jeffrey Archer, Malala, Roddy Doyle and many more. 2018's brilliantly varied list featured books by Dorothy Koomson, Tammy Cohen, Kit de Waal, Vaseem Khan, Mark Billingham and Fern Britton. This year, after announcing we had been unable to secure financial support to keep the scheme going, we were stunned to receive an incredible gift from best-selling author Jojo Moyes (Me Before You), who generously offered us three years of funding for Quick Reads. The money will allow us to continue the scheme and relaunch a new and improved list of Quick Reads in 2020. record.pwc_description: Get started with HQ! Learn more about this exciting platform with a list of frequently asked questions.
record.pwc_body: HQ FAQs General Information What is HQ? HQ is the Firm's new intranet platform, replacing myKcurve, PwC's legacy intranet of more than 10 years. This new site, powered by Adobe Experience Manager, further drives our Your Tomorrow strategy by serving as a modern, personalized portal that's your front door to firmwide and LoS news, tools and resources. PwC HQ is designed to give you easier access to the information you need to work, day in and day out. The user-friendly interface thoughtfully streamlines navigation and content so that you have on-demand access to the top apps and sites that you use on a daily basis. Fun fact: the name HQ (an abbreviation for headquarters) was chosen by our partners and staff back in January when we launched a survey to choose the name for our new intranet. Over 6,400 of you voted on the first piece of bringing this new site to life! For more information, refer to the About HQ page. What are some of the key features of HQ? The first release of HQ is called an MVP - Minimum Viable Product launch, which means that this is just the beginning and HQ will continue to be enhanced in the coming months. The following features are currently included: New look and feel, mobile-friendly user experience Streamlined navigation (fewer navigation items, more intuitive ways to get to underlying content, customizable Quick Links) Personalization (content across the site is targeted according to your personal attributes e.g. LoS, Sector, location) Key Dates (see upcoming firmwide events and add them to your Google calendar with one click) Stay tuned for more information on future enhancements. What will be included in future releases? Our HQ roadmap will continue to be refined and grow in the coming months. Right now, key items for our product roadmap include: Integrate predictive data and insights from the new myMetrics; Astro alignment Integrate key sites and systems into HQ search (align with enterprise search/Fathom on the front end) Expand personalization/preferences and analytics Mexico portal migration (via Spark) Partner Portal evaluation and approach Email/newsletter solution alignment and integration Collaboration platform alignment Is myKcurve going away? The front-end staff experience of myKcurve will no longer be available. However, the partner portal, also on Kcurve, will not be turned off in June and will be available to partners through personalized navigation. Is HQ available on mobile? The first release is "mobile-responsive." Post MVP, we will move towards "mobile-native," or an experience that can be fully realized in app format (with app notifications). Will HQ have social and/or collaboration functionality? You will have the ability to share content from HQ with other partners and staff. More community functionality (commenting and liking, for example) will be introduced in future releases of HQ. The US firm is currently exploring options for firmwide collaboration tools. Once that decision has been made, the approved solution for collaboration may be integrated into the HQ experience. Is HQ replacing Spark? No, HQ is not replacing Spark. The firm is in the process of reviewing collaboration and self-service web creation tools that will support the future demands of our Your Tomorrow agenda, but for now, we will still use Spark. With that said, there is content on Spark that is integral to our new digital workplace experience -- content that represents our firm strategy, structure and values -- that we will evaluate and update for potential migration onto HQ. Is HQ available in Mexico? The Mexico portal experience will remain on Spark in the near-term but we are looking to migrate it to HQ in FY20. Is HQ available to contractors or employees outside the US? Our contractor and PwC global employees will not have the personalization features in HQ that are available to our US employees (as these are pulled from Workday), but they will be able to view the content. How can I personalize my HQ experience? On Day 1, you can enhance your HQ experience by populating your Quick Links and ensuring that your personalization settings are properly set. The personal attributes (according to Workday) that will inform the content that you see in your homepage news feed and suggested Quick Links are: line of service, sector/subsector and location. You can see the attributes from your Workday profile by clicking the person link in the top right corner of your HQ screen. How can I find information outside of my personalized areas? If you are looking for content that isnt personalized to you (e.g., youre in Advisory and looking for information or news from Assurance), use Search and then filter by any LoS. In the future, we will be adding additional personalization features and you will also have the ability to subscribe to news from other lines of service, sectors and locations. How can I customize my Quick Links? Quick Links are designed to give you one-click access to the sites and systems you frequent most (see visual here). You have ten Quick Links available in your left hand navigation. Four of those ten Quick Links have been pre-populated based on your role at the firm, e.g., Tax Source for a Tax employee, or Consulting Source for an Advisory employee. All Quick Links can be edited, including the ones that are pre-populated. Staff can choose Quick Links by selecting the HQ Link Index, which will open an index of ~400 sites and systems that staff frequent most. You can add or remove a Quick Link by selecting the + or - button to the right of the link in the Link Index. How can I find my LoS/function information? You will see personalized news appear on the HQ homepage, specific to your LoS, sector and location. LoS communications and change teams will continue to create and publish content. In addition, you can find the LOS homepages in the Our Clients and Business navigation menu and these pages will link out to other areas. How can I provide feedback on HQ? Visit the HQ feedback community to share your ideas for product enhancements, see what others have suggested and vote on the ideas youd like to see come to life. Your participation in this feedback tool will help the HQ team identify and prioritize enhancements to the sites user experience, influencing the sites user experience and product roadmap. How can I search on HQ? HQ makes it easier to access the information you need to deliver for our clients and our firm, and do so more efficiently. The HQ search functionality is a simplified experience that provides a single search bar, instead of the toggle search functionality available previously on myKcurve. Therefore, HQ search results will only display content (i.e., pages, microsites) and news (firmwide and LoS) that are native to HQ and will not surface all results from the sources that could be found on the myKcurve search bar (e.g., Fathom, A&A, Tax Source). Over time, HQ search will become more robust as we integrate with other platforms. Please stay tuned for updates on the timing of these, and other, HQ enhancements. In the meantime, access to individual search repositories, including Fathom, A&A and Tax Source, can be added as Quick Links or found in the Link Index. Will I be able to set reminders of my own on HQ? Yes, you can add certain firmwide key dates to your calendar. Navigate to the Key Dates section of HQ and click the add to calendar icon for available events. Once Astro, PwCs cognitive agent, is launched firmwide, we will add the ability for you to see a more personalized list of To Dos, including a view of any tasks that youve set in Google Tasks and those added via Astro. How can I request new pages to be added to HQ? If youd like to develop a new HQ page or migrate a site from another platform into HQ, please contact the HQ Team. Where do I go if I experience issues with HQ? If you have general questions/ comments about your HQ experience or need feedback community support, contact the HQ Team. For technical assistance with HQ (e.g., report bugs, personalization settings not working), please submit a request through Service Hub. Need additional help? Tech support HQ bugs and requests for technology support should be directed to Service Hub. Requests for content To request new HQ content/pages or changes to existing content/pages, please contact the HQ Team. Feedback Visit the HQ feedback community to share your ideas for product enhancements, see what others have suggested and vote on the ideas youd like to see come to life.

record.pwc_description: This page includes additional information for getting started with our new intranet platform, HQ -- including HQ Pages, News, Search, Links, and Personalization. This page will be kept up to date with stories and updates related to new platform enhancements and integrations.
record.pwc_body: About HQ Get started with HQ! Click below to learn more about this exciting platform. About HQ HQ is our new intranet platform, replacing myKCurve. This modern digital workplace will serve as your front door to firmwide and LoS news, tools and resources. Together with myMetrics 2.0 and Astro, HQ is part of our journey toward an integrated digital experience across the firm. HQ Pages Each page within HQ is managed by a specific PwC team or function. If you have questions about content other than the HQ home page, please submit them through the Questions for the Team link on the page you are viewing. To request new HQ content/pages or changes to existing content/pages, please contact the HQ team. Need more help finding the content you need? Check out our Quick Reference Card. News News is personalized on the HQ home page, from top to bottom of the page by LoS, Sector, Sub-sector and Location. In addition, you'll see key firmwide news at the top of your page and in your news feed. The PwC Inside email will continue to be sent on Tuesdays and Fridays. New content will also be posted on the HQ home page regularly throughout the week. If you have a piece of news youd like to submit, please email our editorial team. Search Search results display content (pages, microsites) and news (firmwide and LoS) native to HQ and do not include links from the Link Index (the Link Index can be filtered from within the Link Index page) Initially, searches wont surface all of the results from Fathom, Accounting & Auditing (A&A), Tax Source, etc. that could be found from the search bar on myKcurve. But in subsequent releases, HQ search will integrate with these other platforms and display those results in addition to content and news native to HQ. In the meantime, the individual repositories for search - like Fathom, Accounting & Auditing (A&A) and Tax Source - can be added as Quick Links, or they can also be found in the Link Index. Quick Links Quick Links provide you easy access to your favorite applications and resources. By default, you are provided with a set of priority Quick Links, chosen by your LoS. You can change these or add more for a total of ten custom Quick Links. To add more, click Add to quick links (or Edit quick links if you have ten already set), search or browse for your favorite app, then select + to add it to your Quick Links. To remove one, click -. Personalization Your HQ experience is personalized, based on the data assigned to you in Workday. Currently, personalization is driven by your LoS, Sector, Sub-sector and Location (Market or Office). Future releases will expand personalization, as will HQs artificial intelligence that learns your search preferences the more you use it. HQ News and Quick Links are personalized to you. If you are looking for content that isnt personalized to you (e.g., youre in Advisory and looking for information or news from Assurance), use Search and then filter by any LoS. Need additional help? Tech support HQ bugs and requests for technology support should be directed to Service Hub. Requests for content To request new HQ content/pages or changes to existing content/pages, please contact the HQ team. FAQs Please see the attached list of Frequently Asked Questions about HQ. Feedback Visit the HQ feedback community to share your ideas for product enhancements, see what others have suggested and vote on the ideas youd like to see come to life. News If you have a piece of news youd like to submit, please email our editorial team.

record.pwc_title: Is your client asking about information security?
record.pwc_page_title: Is your client asking about information security? These resources will help
record.pwc_nav_title: Is your client asking about information security? These resources will help
record.pwc_body: Is your client asking about information security? Is your client asking about information security? Network Information Security June 7, 2019 We all work with information every day and we each play a role in protecting the information entrusted to PwC, whether it belongs to our clients, our business or our people. The Information Security Policy (ISP) Controls Standard outlines the minimum security baselines with which all partners and staff must comply. This short ISP Training video provides a quick overview. The ISP is designed to help protect PwC from threats by safeguarding and maintaining the integrity of PwC and client information, meeting relevant legal, professional and regulatory obligations, and ensuring the PwC brand is protected. It also includes supporting standards and guidance that help us understand how our day-to-day responsibilities contribute to keeping our client and firm information safe. For more on talking to clients about PwCs information security, see the ISP Security Statement. For additional day-to-day guidance, you can also refer to the Information Protection Policy and resources page. For further tips, check out these short videos: No Need for Plastic: How PwC exchanges data securely Haste Makes Waste: How PwC develops secure digital solutions ISP = Peace of Mind: How PwC secures client data For more security tips and education, visit the Information Security Awareness page.

record.pwc_title: Virginia Beach shooting and being prepared
record.pwc_description: Tim Ryan: Throughout the weekend, my thoughts were with the 12 people in the Virginia Beach community who went to work on Friday and never returned home.
record.pwc_body: Virginia Beach shooting and being prepared Virginia Beach shooting and being prepared Tim Ryan June 3, 2019 Team, Late Friday afternoon we saw another terrible and senseless shooting this time in Virginia Beach. Throughout the weekend, my thoughts were with the 12 people who went to work on Friday and never returned home. And now their family, friends and community are grieving. While I hope that none of us ever has to experience a situation like this, our security team does plan and prepare for these and other crisis scenarios. We take measures to protect our office environments and also hold drills to practice our response to emergencies. We have an instructional video you can watch to help you prepare for active shooter situations. Sadly, we know violent events can happen at any time, so its important for all of us to sharpen our security instincts. As a reminder, in any threatening situation, call 911 first. You can also access support and guidance in an emergency through the PwC Emergency Hotline 1-888-755-1515 or by email (security@pwc.com). Team, I wish we didnt have to think about preparing for events like this. And we wish that the people of Virginia Beach as well as so many other communities were not facing violence and loss. We'll continue to do our best to create a safe environment within PwC. Top News

record.pwc_title: A yogi in Bali: One PwCers mindful sabbatical
record.pwc_description: Lanie Potgieter used her career milestone sabbatical to disconnect and immerse herself in yoga instructor training.
record.pwc_body: A yogi in Bali: One PwCers mindful sabbatical A yogi in Bali: One PwCers mindful sabbatical People Team June 7, 2019 Reaching the senior manager or director level is a significant career accomplishment worth celebrating. As part of our Rewards Strategy, eligible newly promoted client service senior managers and IFS directors are awarded a four-week sabbatical -- a chance to unwind, recharge and truly focus on their well-being through Be well, work well -- a key component of Your Tomorrow. In 2012, Lanie Potgieter left her home of Cape Town, South Africa for a short-term international tour in New York City. Little did she know, the move would become permanent and was the start of an incredible journey of personal growth. Being a senior associate in PwCs New York City office (at the time) was both a thrill and challenge, Lanie admits. Although I was working long hours and feeling a little homesick, the experience provided a new perspective on well-being. To keep up with the fast-pace of the Big Apple, Lanie recognized the importance of energy renewal. With the encouragement of her partner and mentor John Gottfried, she decided to invest more time in well-being and find balance by trying yoga. Being on the yoga mat allows me to feel fully present and melts away my stress, said Lanie. I learned how to balance assertiveness and softness and quickly began to see how that balance was having a positive effect on my relationships and approach to work. Yoga had such a profound effect on Lanie that she decided to become an instructor to help others discover the many health benefits of yoga and mindfulness. In November 2018, she used her career milestone sabbatical to attend an intensive yoga training program in Bali. I researched many teacher training programs and ultimately decided to travel far from home, she says. I wanted to completely disconnect and immerse myself in the experience. The 24-day program was incredible! Although yoga works for Lanie, she recognizes it may not be for everyone. She advises people to Be well, work well by finding what they enjoy doing to re-energize and sticking with it. Not every yoga practice is easy for me. Some days are better than others. But I always return to my mat, because I know in the end, its going to make me feel great and help me be my best self. Visit our Rewards Strategy site to learn more about milestone sabbaticals and PwC's Career Milestone program. Contact: US_People-Communications@pwc.com Top News

record.pwc_title: How a request to the Digital Lab team led to saving 160+ man-hours
record.pwc_description: digital lab
record.pwc_body: How a request to the Digital Lab team led to saving 160+ man-hours How a request to the Digital Lab team led to saving 160+ man-hours The Need When our client Jabil, a leading manufacturing solutions provider, tasked our team with helping them implement SAP Lease Administration by Nakisa (SLAN), a leasing application, our team quickly realized this project was a perfect opportunity to bring Your Tomorrow to life with some automation, but they needed help. You see SLAN uses Excel spreadsheets to manage configuration data before uploading en masse into the application. The team recognized right away that the amount of repetitive manual Excel activities not only increased chances of human error, but also exposed the project to timeline delays. The solution was looking us dead in the eye, but the problem was, no one on our team had the time or the full knowledge to build a solution themselves. Manish Dharnidharka Advisory partner We reached out to some contacts we had on the Digital Lab team, explained our problem and we quickly got to work, added Richard Cebula, managing director in our TMT vertical. Digital Lab Solution With the help of Mike Huwyler and Joe Kressler, the Digital Lab team helped build two apps/tools: A data transformation process flow that would take one golden company code and apply the same configuration for the remaining 121 company codes in each of the 52 tabs in the SLAN Excel template. A process automation (bot) that took individual pieces of configuration data from the SLAN Development environment and applied it into the SLAN Excel template for the next environment (Test or Production) The Win By using data analysis and automation on this engagement, the following benefits were realized: Time saved. The data transformation process flow ran in under five minutes for an activity that would have taken a human 16 hours; not only on time, but every time a configuration update was required by the client. The automation program ran in under 10 minutes for an activity that would have taken a day or more to do at least 4x (1x for each environment). Overall saving 160+ man-hours. Accuracy. By using process automation, the project team avoided any human error that would have resulted in 60+ hours of error resolution and correction. Re-use. These applications can be reused on other Nakisa projects in the future. Contact: Layna.Dugan@pwc.com Top News

record.pwc_description: On this LGBT+ Initiatives page of Diversity & Inclusion learn more about how our strategy is designed to engage, support and advance our LGBT+ professionals and promote an inclusive and accepting work environment.
record.pwc_body: LGBT+ Initiatives LGBT+ Our LGBT+ (lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, +) professionals are an important community within PwC and with our clients. The firms strategy is designed to engage, support and advance our LGBT+ professionals and promote an inclusive and accepting work environment. We take action by Having an LGBT+ Partner Advisory Board since 2004 that raises visibility of the LGBT+ community within PwC and makes policy recommendations for how the firm can attract, retain and advance LGBT+ professionals. Providing full domestic partner benefit coverage and programs that support a broad range of family needs, including adoption and surrogacy. Proudly supporting the transgender community and its allies. We joined 180 other CEOs and corporate leaders who are calling for respect for all and equality under the law for transgender, gender non-binary and intersex people. Providing professional development opportunities for LGBT+ staff via the national and global LGBT+ summits and through our external partnerships to convene our LGBT+ community. Connecting LGBT+ professionals with allies, learners, members and supporters through our Shine Network. Resources Highlighted partnerships - GLAAD, Human Rights Campaign (HRC), OutLeadership and The Trevor Project LGBT+ timeline PwC sponsored research with OutLeadership - Out to Succeed and Visibility Counts Pursuit of Happiness Podcast - Gender Inclusion with Jean Malpas from the Ackerman Institute Workplace gender inclusivity and transition guidelines Find additional resources in the Shine Network Office of Diversity Contacts Our Initiatives Disability & Caregivers Gender Minorities Parenting Veterans

record.pwc_description: On this subpage of Diversity & Inclusion learn more about what our diversity and inclusion efforts mean for our clients.
record.pwc_body: D&I Clients Clients and D&I Clients often ask about PwCs diversity efforts. They want our engagement teams to reflect the diversity within their own organizations, and to know that we leverage it to deliver high-quality service. Our diverse client service teams solve problems and bring solutions to our clients. Talking to clients about D&I We encourage you to engage clients around diversity and inclusion. The tools in this section are all external and intended to be shared with clients: Ability Reveals Itself Impact Report Blind spots video series CEO Action (encourage clients to take the I Act on Pledge and follow the Check Your Blind Spots Unconscious Bias Mobile Tour) Global diversity & inclusion survey Implicit Association Tests (IAT) Outsmarting Human Minds series Pursuit of Happiness podcast Workforce of the Future Requests for Proposals (RFPs) RFPs often ask about the firm's diversity programs and demographics. We designed an internal toolkit, Diversity Opens Doors, to support teams as they create RFPs. If your client requests a D&I conversation or diversity data, please reach out to your Market Diversity Leader to discuss. Supplier Diversity PwC recognizes that our diversity efforts have a positive economic impact on the communities where we do business. Through our Supplier Diversity initiative, we look for diverse companies to add to our supply chain and complement the services we provide our clients. PwC partners with business enterprises that are qualified and certified as minority-owned (MBE), women-owned (WBE), disability-owned (DBE), veteran-owned (VBE) and lesbian/gay/bisexual/transgender-owned (LGBT+). The firm also supports organizations and programs that certify, train and develop diverse suppliers. And, we help our clients meet their own supplier diversity requirements. Requests for proposals from our clients often call for strategies to include diverse suppliers; we work closely with these firms during the contracting process. In addition to helping our clients, we're providing support to the communities where we do business and promoting economic development in a fast-growing segment of the population. Our Initiatives Disability & Caregivers Gender LGBT+ Minorities Parenting Veterans

record.pwc_description: On this Minorities Initiatives page of Diversity & Inclusion learn more about our diversity programs aimed at attracting, retaining, and advancing talented minority staff and partners.
record.pwc_body: Minority Initiatives Minorities We know diverse teams are more innovative and create more impactful solutions. We seek to attract, retain, develop and advance talented minority staff and partners through our diversity programs. We support early career success through learning resources focused on individuals' unique experiences. We take action by Promoting cultural awareness education to enhance global acumen. Our programs provide access to role models & mentors to provide career coaching and guidance. Hosting Signature Leadership Experiences designed to help diverse, high-performing professionals accelerate their success and reach even higher in their careers. Providing opportunities to broaden their networks by participating with strategic external sponsorships with diverse organizations that focus on leadership development. Connecting our professionals with students to help continue to attract and recruit top talent to PwC. Embedding a diversity and inclusion lens into all aspects of the career lifecycle. Connecting minorities with allies, learners, members and supporters through our Black Inclusion Network (BIN), Latino Inclusion Network (LIN) and Pan Asian Community Inclusion Network (PACIN). Resources Blind spots video series Highlighted partnerships -- ALPFA, Ascend, NABA, Tanenbaum and Multicultural Womens Conference Add holiday and cultural observances to your calendar Outsmarting Human Minds Responsible Business Leadership -- Access Your Potential and Dollars for Doers Talent Acquisition initiatives -- Start, Career Preview, Howard University Center for Accounting Education Find additional resources in the Black Inclusion Network (BIN), Latino Inclusion Network (LIN) and Pan Asian Community Inclusion Network (PACIN) Office of Diversity Contacts Our Initiatives Disability & Caregivers Gender LGBT+ Parenting Veterans

record.pwc_description: On this Veterans Initiatives page of Diversity & Inclusion learn more about the programs we've created to support our veterans, active duty military personnel and their families at work and in the community
record.pwc_body: Veterans Initiatives Veterans PwC understands the depth and breadth of experience veterans bring to our country and our firm. We have created programs that support our veterans, active duty military personnel and their families at work and in the community and weve enhanced our veterans initiatives to be a military-friendly professional services employer. We take action by Creating a community of support for PwCs veterans and their families, as well as those with loved ones in the military. Focusing on five key areas: veteran recruiting; outreach and networking for personal and professional development and community service opportunities; education; mentorship and family readiness. Providing mentorship opportunities through the VAN Mentorship Program, which offers newly-hired PwC veterans an opportunity to develop a relationship with and be formally mentored by more-experienced PwC veterans on matters of personal and professional development. Connecting veterans with allies, learners, members and supporters through our Veterans Affinity Network (VAN). Resources Military and Veterans recruiting Highlighted partnerships - Four Block and Student Veterans of America PwC Charitable Foundation - Veterans Find additional resources in the Veterans Affinity Network (VAN) Office of Diversity Contacts Our Initiatives Disability & Caregivers Gender LGBT+ Minorities Parenting

Promoting flexibility for everyone and providing specific support for caregivers. Connecting caregivers with allies, learners, members and supporters through our Parenting Network. record.pwc_description: On this page find out what market and national support networks are available for Diversity & Inclusion.
record.pwc_body: Contacts Contacts Need more information, have questions or want to learn more? We have numerous market and national support networks for our partners and staff: Market Diversity Leader The Market Diversity Leader (MDL) works with market leadership to retain, develop and advance women and diverse talent at PwC. Reach out to your MDL if you: Want a holistic local market/vertical perspective on our D&I efforts Would like to build your network of coaches to help you develop and advance your career Would like to get involved in local D&I efforts Have questions on any of the available D&I programs or Inclusion Networks MDLs by market: Central Name: TBD Home office: TBD Mid-Atlantic Lety Juan Tysons, VA Midwest Cami Negret Cleveland, OH New York (Assurance/PCS) Rosemary Guider (ToD) New York, NY New York (Assurance/PCS) Amma Osei New York, NY New York (Tax) Lisa Cordova New York, NY New York (Advisory) Paula Theus New York, NY Northeast Allyson Schiller Boston, MA Bay Area Northwest Moire Rasmussen San Francisco, CA Southeast Jackie Martin Atlanta, GA Southwest Henry Brandt Los Angeles, CA Texas Renu Sachdeva Houston, TX LoS D&I Director The LoS D&I Director (LoSDL) serves as the primary diversity advisor to LoS leadership and collaborates with them to drive the D&I strategy within the LoS. The LoSDL has a focus on strategic initiatives to retain, develop, and advance women and minorities, particularly at the senior manager/director level. When would I reach out to my LoSDL? Reach out to your LoSDL anytime you want a better understanding of the specific LoS D&I efforts. In addition, reach out if you: Would like to build your LoS network of coaches to help you develop and advance your career, particularly at the senior manager/director level Want to better understand the role and priorities of the LoS Diversity Partner Champion Network Want to contribute to LoS efforts or offer D&I educational experiences in LoS sector conferences Who are the LoSDLs? (by LoS) Advisory Hannah Wu Assurance Chris Brassell Tax & PCS Raechel Levine Diversity Partner Champion Network The Diversity Partner Champion (DPC) Network is a xLoS team committed to leading our D&I efforts and are a valuable resource for all staff and partners. Each of our markets and go-to-market teams have DPCs who dedicate hundreds of hours working with our recruiting teams, client service professionals and respective D&I leadership teams to drive our efforts. Our DPC network is managed by a D&I Partner Leader for each LoS who guides priorities and focus for their respective LoS. When would I reach out to a DPC? Reach out to your DPC anytime you want a leaders perspective on our D&I efforts. For example, if you: Want to better understand the depth and breadth of PwCs D&I strategy and impact Are seeking opportunities to get engaged and plugged into local D&I activity and efforts Need an additional resource to discuss career guidance and leadership support and development Who are the LoS D&I Partner Leaders? (By LoS) Advisory Alie Hoover Assurance Sheri Wyatt PCS Suzanne Fradette Tax Lissett Margarita Tautfest Who is part of the DPC network? Here is the full listing of our network that can be viewed by LoS, Market, or Vertical. record.pwc_description: On this Diversity & Inclusion subpage, find out how you can take action, get involved and make an impact.
record.pwc_body: Take action Take action We all play a role in cultivating a culture of inclusion and belonging. Here's how you can get involved and make an impact. I want to get involved with diversity and inclusion nationally or in my local market Join one of our Inclusion Networks to connect with and learn from your colleagues. Our Inclusion Networks are for everyone - allies, learners, members and supporters. Learn about and engage in one of our professional affiliations, including ALPFA, Ascend and NABA. In most cases, PwC reimburses for annual professional affiliation memberships for client service professionals. Check with your Talent Consultant for your teams policy. I want to build my inclusion acumen Participate in an Inclusive Leadership and Belonging session -- a multi-faceted training initiative to help partners and staff understand the impact they have and the role they play in creating a sense of belonging for all. Get insights from psychological science to help improve the decisions we make in life and at work through Outsmarting Human Minds and PwC discussion guide. Learn how unconscious bias can impact behavior and decisions. Watch Blind spots 4REAL, a four-part interactive video series based on a fictional company and featuring a team who is influenced by unconscious bias and explore our Blind spots video series. Check out this Coaching Across Differences Vantage Playlist to be a more inclusive leader. Get a behind-the-scenes look at our people and the choices they make to live the lives they want in the Pursuit of Happiness podcast. Check out upcoming Coaching with an Inclusive Mindset sessions in your market. Listen to the Candid conversations: Respect in the Workplace podcast. Watch webcast replays: Disability Caregivers | Professionals with Disabilities | All of us: A candid conversation about gender on International Women's Day 2019 I want to be a champion for diversity and inclusion Take the CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion I Act On pledge and commit to check your bias, speak up for others and show up for all. Through our partnership with the UN Women's HeForShe initiative, we are working toward achieving global gender equality in the workplace and beyond. Join us by taking the HeForShe pledge. Complete one or more Implicit Association Tests (IAT) and commit to talking about it with your colleagues. Check out the calendar of upcoming Inclusion Network events Our Initiatives Disability & Caregivers Gender LGBT+ Minorities Parenting Veterans

record.pwc_description: On this Gender Initiatives page of Diversity & Inclusion learn more about how we strive to attract, retain, develop and advance women at all stages in their careers
record.pwc_body: Gender initiatives Gender We are committed to gender equality. That means we strive to attract, retain, develop and advance women at all stages in their careers. record.pwc_title: 8 ways AI is shaping business in 2018
record.pwc_body: 8 ways AI is shaping business in 2018 8 ways AI is shaping business in 2018 Marketing & Sales Jan. 18, 2018 Are the robots really coming for jobs? How do you get started with artificial intelligence? Do you have the right AI talent? How will tax reform affect investment in AI development? From the boardroom to the breakroom, AI is becoming part of every business conversation. We know its on our clients minds and our new report, AI Predictions in 2018, takes a look at the big picture, putting a stake in the ground on the most important AI issues businesses will face in 2018. More than two dozen PwC leaders from across the US and UK firms weighed in on what AI means, and the results are relevant regardless of your line, sector or market. Heres what those leaders see collectively in the crystal ball and what businesses need to know in the coming months: Are the robots really coming for jobs? How do you get started with artificial intelligence? Do you have the right AI talent? How will tax reform affect investment in AI development? From the boardroom to the breakroom, AI is becoming part of every business conversation. We know its on our clients minds and our new report, AI Predictions in 2018, takes a look at the big picture, putting a stake in the ground on the most important AI issues businesses will face in 2018. More than two dozen PwC leaders from across the US and UK firms weighed in on what AI means, and the results are relevant regardless of your line, sector or market. Heres what those leaders see collectively in the crystal ball and what businesses need to know in the coming months: AI will impact employers before it impacts employment. AI will hardly ruffle the job market in 2018. But since it demands new structures, enterprises will feel pressure to retool. AI will come down to earth and get to work. It may not make a good science fiction film, but AI is ready to automate complex processes, identify trends to create business value, and provide forward-looking intelligence. AI will help answer the big question about data. AI isnt the only answer to the ROI question about data integration and technology initiatives, but its an answer that comes with business cases. Functional specialists, not techies, will decide the AI talent race. Computer scientists are important, but domain experts with the skills to work with AI and AI experts are crucial for enterprise success. Cyberattacks will be more powerful because of AI but so will cyberdefense. One job where AI has already shown clear superiority over human beings? Hacking. And now it will be crucial to your cybersecurity strategy. Opening AIs black box will become a priority. A risk of AI: We wont understand why it does what it does. The lack of trust will hurt adoption but solutions are coming. Nations will spar over AI. Its not a trade war but a research, investment and talent war, and China is moving fast. Pressure for responsible AI wont just be on tech companies. A global consensus is emerging around principles for responsible AI to safeguard organizations and drive business value. Stay tuned: Our CEO Survey launches Monday at Davos Our 21st Annual Global CEO Survey launches Monday, Jan. 22, at the World Economic Forum in Davos. You can check out the first in ourstrategy+business CEO interview series now, as Oracle chief executive Safra Catz explains the broad culture shift brought on by artificial intelligence and cloud technologies. Watch PwC Inside on Monday and in the coming weeks for more CEO Survey resources, and visit these sites for the very latest: Add a calendar reminder atpwc.com/davos to join the live webcast of our Davos press conference and report release on Monday, Jan. 22, at 12:30 p.m. ET Bookmark two key Spark sites -- CEO Survey - Global and CEO Survey - US-- which will be refreshed with materials on launch day and as new materials are released Access the full findings at www.pwc.com/us/AI2018. Promotion Day Friday, June 21, 8:30 a.m. Click me Add to Calendar Top News Community Sites Click me Key Dates Opened Welcome to Outsmarting Human Minds (OHM) -- another opportunity to continue learning about blind spots, and to engage our teams and our clients along the way. With a grant from PwC, Harvard University developed this series of podcasts, videos and other materials that apply insights from psychological science to help us improve the decisions we make in life and at work. To be clear, OHM doesnt take the place of the 4REAL series; rather, it is the next extension. Resources Digital Hub One Firm Risk Organization Internal Firm Services
Dan

Multiple video embeds Multiple video embeds People Team June 12, 2018 A typical work day provides us with many chances to have a meaningful conversation with a colleague or client. Investing in developing our teams and ourselves is one way we can make a difference. Ask yourself: Am I supporting an environment of Real-time development (RTD) within my team? Model the behavior of giving and receiving feedback with your teams and make it a daily habit. Not only will you feel good, but it fuels our emotional well-being, which positively impacts our performance. And be sure to celebrate successes and show appreciation along the way. Download the new RTD Engagement Team Toolkit from PwCs App Store. The toolkit includes in-the-moment actions you can take at the start, middle and end of an engagement/project. Take this quiz to get a real-time reality check. Am I regularly initiating and acknowledging Snapshots? The mobile Snapshot app is designed to be initiated easily and quickly for on-the-go professionals. Your Snapshots should cover work done to-date and 80% of your hours at any point during the year. Keep your TalentLink profile up to date. As a reviewer, have I completed the Snapshots Ive received? Open the menu (upper-left corner in the Snapshot app) where the "Snapshots to Complete" item will indicate how many Snapshots need to be completed. Consider setting up time with your reviewer or reviewee to complete a Snapshot together. Check out Own Your Leadership Experience for additional guidance and examples of development actions, performance differentiators and future focus areas to help you complete Snapshots. Key resources: Spark: Own your leadership development experience New on Vantage: Check out these Role of the Career Coach and RTD playlists or leverage Vantage for recommended learning opportunities aligned with the PwC Professional. record.pwc_body: Tax home Acceleration Centers are key to our strategy Roy Weathers, Vice Chairman and US Tax Leader Acceleration Centers To reflect our strategy, we have rebranded our SDCs -- now known as Acceleration Centers. The ACs are critical to how we work -- including how we deliver quality and digitize our work. Phoenix updates All non-IAS Tax engagement teams should be using Phoenix for submitting their engagement forecast and work requests to their Acceleration Center teams. Its important that we use Phoenix consistently to send work to our centers (with very limited exceptions) to help drive standardization. By using Phoenix consistently, we can unleash the full functionality of workflow and associated notifications/communication capabilities. For example, the workflow now includes a two-way feedback option to give a star rating on each of your requests. record.pwc_title: Anti-Bribery Anti-Corruption Integrated Solution for the win at Bunge Limited
record.pwc_description: Bunge Limited was looking to assess and enhance their global compliance program, with a focus on bribery and corruption risks. Our ABAC Integrated Solution will be a game-changer to solve this.
record.pwc_body: Anti-Bribery Anti-Corruption Integrated Solution for the win at Bunge Anti-Bribery Anti-Corruption Integrated Solution for the win at Bunge Limited Advisory - test June 18, 2019 What was the challenge Bunge asked us to solve? Bunge Limited was looking to assess and enhance their global compliance program, with a focus on bribery and corruption risks specific to third-party management and monitoring of higher risk activities. While going through this process, they wanted to preserve the brand trust established during their 200 operational years and equip the company to better face anti-bribery and anti-corruption (ABAC) compliance challenges of today, tomorrow and into the future. What was our solution for Bunge? We held a brainstorming workshop with Bunges compliance team and shared real-time ideas with them to drive enhancements on the design and execution of their ABAC Compliance Program, particularly related to third-party risk management and monitoring activities. The team leveraged the framework of our ABAC Integrated Solution, including our methodology to help clients prepare for, respond to and emerge stronger from compliance challenges, and demos of certain proprietary digital assets. Our broad and cross-functional approach was driven by a team with diverse functional and sector experience and was enabled through the demonstration of digital assets, for example compliance tracker, offering the ability to provide clarity around key risks and visibility into the unknown. Delivering the solution with a BXT approach, from a consumer perspective, wowed the Bunge leadership team who said, "there was a consensus at Bunge about the quality of your work and the presentation." What results will Bunge see using our solution? The use of a technology enabled solution should help Bunge to increase efficiencies in monitoring execution which will deliver increased value to the organization, through the following: -Centralized web-based platform (Compliance Tracker) to manage the monitoring analytics, execution and reporting -Case management to track potential compliance matters from identification through remediation, with customizable workflow and audit trail -Tailored monitoring summary dashboards to simplify and visualize results for management and executives. -Automation of data processing, analytics, and on-demand reporting. More visibility and clarity into risks and the unknown, allowing Bunge to make better strategic and tactical decisions in managing its business in various complex locations on a global basis. More consistent view of key areas of risk and higher risk third parties on a go forward basis. Lessons learned from certain locations that can be applied to the business in a broader manner. How is this win significant and what results will we see? A substantial margin delivered for the firm at ~34%. A showcase in Advisory 2.0 strategic agenda with the use of an Integrated Solution, a BXT approach and Your Tomorrow digital usage focus. A streamlined, digital approach that can be consistently applied across xLoS PwC engagements by leveraging the Digital Compliance & Fraud Office (DCFO) technology tool, Compliance Tracker. Enhanced relationships across functional areas at the company and a strong showing of our Risk and Regulatory platform messaging- focusing the complexity of risk into a powerful business strategy by helping clients proactively understand and evolve with the changing global regulatory landscape. Ability to identify other areas where we may be able to add value for the client and introduce others to bring new ideas. New insights to showcase on our recently launched Anti-bribery Anti-corruption external webpage! Meet the team! This was truly a team effort and we had close interactions and support from the account team, from the GEP (Peter Frank) to the client driver (Donna Panettiere). We know there are many more stories to tell. Please let us know if you have an Integrated Solutions win we should feature. Want to learn more about Integrated Solutions? Check out Consulting Source and the Integrated Solutions Learning Hub. Contact: us_integrated-solutions@pwc.com Top News

record.pwc_title: Congrats to our 14 Elijah Watt Sells award winners
record.pwc_body: Congrats to our 14 Elijah Watt Sells award winners Congrats to our 14 Elijah Watt Sells award winners People Team May 28, 2019 The Elijah Watt Sells Award, presented by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, recognizes individuals who pass all four sections of the Uniform CPA exam on their first attempt and attain a cumulative average score above 95.5. How distinctive is the honor? While 86,000 people took the Uniform CPA exam, only 110 candidates met the award criteria. Were #PwCproud to say that 14 are from PwC a clear reflection of the caliber of our talent. Please join us in congratulating this years winners on their outstanding achievement! record.pwc_title: You matter to us. Checking in when crisis strikes
record.pwc_body: You matter to us. Checking in when crisis strikes You matter to us. Checking in when crisis strikes US Security June 4, 2018 We cant say it enough: Your personal safety is our highest priority. On May 24, we conducted a firmwide test of PwCs crisis alert and response tool, Everbridge. Thanks to you, we had a strong 95% response rate! These periodic drills help us all stay familiar with our crisis communication application. We dont want to leave anyone behind. Get help in a crisis -- or let us know youre OK If you havent already, download the Everbridge app from PwCs App Store or Google Work Play Store. Once downloaded, request a registration link to complete the process. The Everbridge tool is critical to our ability to identify the impact of a crisis on our people by connecting with you, determining your safety status and quickly providing support to you. Be alert, aware and prepared for a crisis. Refresh yourself on PwCs security basics or type Security/ into your PwC web browser for more security tools and resources. You are PwCs most important asset. Stay safe. Top News

record.pwc_title: 6 topics to avoid in convos with competitors
record.pwc_body: 6 topics to avoid in convos with competitors 6 topics to avoid in convos with competitors Ethics & Compliance Jan. 17, 2019 We all go to conferences, meetings and social events. Our competitors do, too. To avoid violating antitrust laws and firm policies, make sure you know what can and cannot be discussed. If in doubt, its best to stay silent. Next time youre in conversation with a competitor, steer clear of these topics: Pricing information and bid rigging Recruiting or hiring practices Salary, wage or benefit information Eliminating or coordinating competition, or discouraging new market entrants Strategic planning and confidential firm or client information Commercial terms, such as terms in our engagement letters Remember Sharon & Trevor? Were you able to escape the office when Sharon and Trevor attended a conference with competitors in this years Independence, Ethics and Compliance training? If you havent completed your FY19 Independence, Ethics and Compliance training, go to My Compliance Dashboard and complete it today. Learn more For more information, please refer to our Antitrust and fair competition policy, Build trust in how we do business section of Our Standards and Quick Guide to Fair Competition. If you have any questions about what you can and cannot discuss with competitors, contact the Office of the General Counsel, the One Firm Risk Organization or Ethics & Compliance via the Ethics HelpLine at 1-888-4-ETHICS or 1-888-438-4427. Top News

record.pwc_title: Please submit your Tax GDM reservations via Phoenix
record.pwc_description: Phoenix, our new One Firm, cloud based, tech enabled workflow platform is here for Tax! Please begin submitting your Tax GDM reservations for all of calendar year 2019 into Phoenix.
record.pwc_body: Please submit your Tax GDM reservations via Phoenix Please submit your Tax GDM reservations via Phoenix Tax Nov. 1, 2018 As you may have seen, Phoenix, our new One Firm, cloud based, tech enabled workflow platform is being rolled out to additional teams this week. Please begin submitting your Tax GDM reservations for all of calendar year 2019 into Phoenix now. All reservations should be submitted by Friday, November 30. This will be our first year utilizing Phoenix, and there are several time saving changes to the submission process, which are detailed below. You do not need to have new WBS codes or current engagement letters in place to set up your reservations. Reservations are now a one-step process, and you no longer have to await approval of your engagement to move forward with planning your hours. Also, as part of our more simplified approach to managing restrictions, when your engagement letter includes (or will include) the standard template language regarding the use of subcontractors or offshore resources, please mark YES to the 7216 question. In those instances where the language has been or is expected to be modified, you should select NO, and you may receive a follow-up email to provide a copy of your Engagement Letter. Within the forecasting section of reservation/engagement creation, you will notice we provide options for auto populating your spread of hours. When you add your service(s) you will need to differentiate between the Review Level requested by adding additional rows under the service (i.e., if you are requesting both preparation and Senior Review for a service, a line with corresponding hours for each should be added separately). Providing this detail is crucial to managing your engagement with the SDC: failing to update this detail may cause delays in starting your engagement. This information may need to be updated throughout the life of your engagement if details change. Helpful reminders: You need to create new engagement/reservations for each Tax year. The custom engagement name should begin with the Tax year such as 2018 Federal Compliance. Future enhancements will allow you to roll over your Engagements year to year minimizing input! When creating your Engagement within Phoenix please use the Client and Engagement name exactly as recorded in FlexForecast. When adding Team Members to the engagement, ensure your Engagement Partner is added to the Engagement Partner role during creation. This facilitates the timely capture of hours against the partners GDM projections. Separate Engagement/reservations are needed for each Engagement Partner within a client. Make sure to complete the forecasting with your best estimate of the weekly hours when you need SDC resources. Your reservations cannot be allocated to an SDC without this. The hours reserved should tie in total to those included as GDM hours in FlexForecast. Number of items is not required at time of reservation, but will be required prior to requesting any services to be performed. As the details regarding the work request (timing, forecast, budgeting, etc.) change throughout the engagement, please update Phoenix accordingly and notify your delivery team via email or call. Please note, the Engagement/reservation will remain unable to be edited until a supervisor is assigned and the Engagement becomes active. Until then, the status will show as under review. GDM Information reporting work will now be reserved with your core Tax reservations using the practice areas of AWM and GIR as appropriate. We will no longer be using the Information Reporting Database. For PCS and PFS work please look for further guidance regarding how to utilize the Engagement Center Workflow integration for forecast submission. If you are interested in discussing more about what GDM can do for your team, please reach out to Katherine Totah (AWM), David Saracino (Corp), Laura Abadie (PCS), Melody Nundy (SALT) and Joseph Frey (any other services) for more details, or visit our TaxSource page. Tax GDM is excited to work with your team as we deliver our future together! You can also visit the Tax Global Delivery Model Tax Source site for information on SDC Activities, Phoenix Resources, FAQs, Key Contacts, and more. Top News
